thread.title: VIDEO: Rory Reid’s Road Trips – driving on the Furka Pass in Switzerland in an Aston Martin Rapide S
thread.title_full: VIDEO: Rory Reid’s Road Trips – driving on the Furka Pass in Switzerland in an Aston Martin Rapide S

author: Gerard Lye
title: VIDEO: Rory Reid’s Road Trips – driving on the Furka Pass in Switzerland in an Aston Martin Rapide S
text:
/ 2 comments 
While we wait for news on when the first episode of Top Gear Series 24 will air, Rory Reid’s side project is certainly a good way to pass the time. In Rory Reid’s Road Trips the British presenter takes us on a tour of some of the world’s most amazing roads in equally amazing vehicles. 
In this episode, we join Reid as he drives an Aston Martin Rapide S on the Furka Pass in Switzerland, a 31-km stretch of road that features 12 hairpin bends. By the time you reach the top, you’re 8,000 feet above sea level and should be in view of the Rhone Glacier. 
If the road looks familiar, you’re probably thinking of the car chase in the 1964 Bond film Goldfinger , where 007 in a DB5, is pursued by a Ford Mustang. Unlike Bond’s car, the Rapide S has significantly more power, seats and cylinders than the DB5, making things a little nervy especially when you consider the pass’ 2,429 metre maximum elevation. 
We’ll let Reid do his thing, giving you more information about the road, accompanied by some gorgeous cinematography that is synonymous with Top Gear . Enjoy. Related Cars for Sale on
